sen.j: 墨（すみ）は、ランプブラックや松煙などから採取したススをゼラチンで練り固めたもの（固形墨）いう。
sen.e: Sumi refers to soot derived from substances such as lampblack or burnt pine, which are solidified by mixing with gelatin (solid sumi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sumi refers to soot derived from substances such as lampblack or burnt pine, solidified by mixing with gelatin (solid sumi).
Sumi refers to soot derived from substances such as lampblack or burnt pine, solidified by mixing with gelatin (solid sumi).

sen.j: またこれを水とともに硯で磨りおろしてつくった黒色の液体をいう。
sen.e: It also refers to the black liquid made by grinding the solid sumi with water against an ink stone.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It also refers to a black liquid made by grinding solid sumi with water against an ink stone.
It also refers to a black liquid made by grinding solid sumi with water against an ink stone.

sen.j: 書画に用いる。
sen.e: It is used for calligraphy and painting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is used for calligraphy and painting.
It is used for calligraphy and painting.

sen.j: 液体の墨はアモルファス炭素の分散したコロイドである。
sen.e: Liquid sumi ink is a colloidal suspension of amorphous carbon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Liquid sumi ink is a colloidal suspension of amorphous carbon.
Liquid sumi ink is a colloidal suspension of amorphous carbon.

sen.j: この状態で市販されているものを墨汁（ぼくじゅう）または墨液と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Those that are sold commercially in this state are called bokuju (liquid sumi ink) or sumijiru (liquid sumi ink).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sumi sold commercially in this state is called bokuju (liquid sumi ink) or sumijiru (liquid sumi ink).
Sumi sold commercially in this state is called bokuju (liquid sumi ink) or sumijiru (liquid sumi ink).

sen.j: 墨汁には古来の墨と異なり化学的に合成された物質が原材料として使われている場合もある。
sen.e: Unlike ancient sumi, chemically synthesized substances are used as main ingredients in some cases of bokuju.
Unlike ancient sumi, chemically synthesized substances are used as main ingredients in some cases of bokuju.
Unlike ancient sumi, chemically synthesized substances are used as main ingredients in some cases of bokuju.

sen.j: 古代中国の甲骨文に墨書や朱墨のあとが発見されている。
sen.e: Remnants of ink writings and red ink are found on the oracle bones of ancient China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Remnants of ink writing and red ink are found on the oracle bones of ancient China.
Remnants of ink writing and red ink are found on the oracle bones of ancient China.

sen.j: 殷の時代に発達した亀甲獣骨文字とときを同じくして使用されたと考えられる。
sen.e: It is considered that sumi ink was in use at the same time as when inscription of ancient Chinese characters on oracle bones and tortoise shells developed during the Yin Dynasty
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is considered that sumi ink was in use at the same time inscriptions of ancient Chinese characters on oracle bones and tortoise shells developed during the Yin Dynasty
It is considered that sumi ink was in use at the same time inscriptions of ancient Chinese characters on oracle bones and tortoise shells developed during the Yin Dynasty

sen.j: 文字以外には入れ墨にも使用され、これはのちに刑罰の一方法となった。
sen.e: Besides writing, it was also used in tattoos, and this later became a method of punishment.
Besides writing, it was also used in tattooing, and this later became a method of punishment.
Besides writing, it was also used in tattooing, and this later became a method of punishment.

sen.j: 墨は漢代には丸めた形に作られ、墨丸という。
sen.e: By the Han Dynasty, sumi was made into a round shape, which was called bokugan (round inkstick).
sen.cmt: 墨丸 読み方および定訳不明
sen.e: By the Han Dynasty, sumi was made into a round shape, called bokugan (round inkstick).
By the Han Dynasty, sumi was made into a round shape, called bokugan (round inkstick).

sen.j: 現存する日本最古の墨書は、三重県嬉野町 (三重県)（現在は松阪市）貝蔵遺跡で出土した2世紀末の土器に記されていた「田」という文字であるとされている。
sen.e: The oldest Japanese ink writing that exists today is said to be the character 'ta' (rice field), which was marked on a late second century clay pot unearthed from the Kaizo ruins in Ureshino-cho, Mie Prefecture (Mie Prefecture) (present-day Matsuzaka City).

The oldest Japanese ink writing that exists today is said to be the character 'ta' (rice field), which was marked on a late second century clay pot unearthed from the Kaizo ruins in Ureshino-cho, Mie Prefecture (Mie Prefecture) (present-day Matsuzaka City).

The oldest Japanese ink writing that exists today is said to be the character 'ta' (rice field), which was marked on a late second century clay pot unearthed from the Kaizo ruins in Ureshino-cho, Mie Prefecture (Mie Prefecture) (present-day Matsuzaka City).

sen.j: 日本では、『日本書紀』に中国の墨について記されているのが初出である。
sen.e: The first mention of sumi in Japan was the description of Chinese sumi in "The Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The first mention of sumi in Japan was a description of Chinese sumi in "The Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
The first mention of sumi in Japan was a description of Chinese sumi in "The Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 国内で作られたものとしては、奈良時代の後期、奈良和束の松煙墨が初めてとされる。
sen.e: Inksticks made from burnt pine in Nara Wazuka during the latter half of the Nara period are considered to be the very first ones made in Japan.
Inksticks made from burnt pine in Nara Wazuka during the latter half of the Nara period are considered to be the very first ones made in Japan.
Inksticks made from burnt pine in Nara Wazuka during the latter half of the Nara period are considered to be the very first ones made in Japan.

sen.j: 油煙墨の製造が始まったのは鎌倉時代である。
sen.e: Production of inksticks made with lamp soot began during the Kamakura period.
Production of inksticks made with lamp soot began during the Kamakura period.
Production of inksticks made with lamp soot began during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると各地で製造されるようになった。
sen.e: The production took place in various regions during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Production took place in various regions during the Edo period.
Production took place in various regions during the Edo period.

sen.j: しかし、古くから実績のある奈良に職人が集まった。
sen.e: However, artisans gathered in Nara, where the production had been taking place since the ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, artisans gathered in Nara, where the production had taken place since the ancient times.
However, artisans gathered in Nara, where the production had taken place since the ancient times.

sen.j: 伝統産業として今日まで受け継がれている。
sen.e: It continues as a traditional industry to this day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It continues as a traditional industry to this day.
It continues as a traditional industry to this day.

sen.j: 現在では奈良県と三重県が主要産地である。
sen.e: Currently, Nara Prefecture and Mie Prefecture are the major producers.
Currently, Nara and Mie Prefectures are the major producers.
Currently, Nara and Mie Prefectures are the major producers.

sen.j: 製造後間もない固形墨は、水分の含有量が多い。
sen.e: Fresh solid sumi contains a substantial amount of water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Fresh solid sumi contains a substantial amount of water.
Fresh solid sumi contains a substantial amount of water.

sen.j: 膠の成分が強く出るために粘度が強い。
sen.e: Characteristic of the animal glue is dominant, therefore it is highly viscous.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Characteristics of animal glue is dominant, therefore it is highly viscous.
Characteristics of animal glue is dominant, therefore it is highly viscous.

sen.j: したがって、紙に書いた場合、芯（筆で書かれた部分）と滲みの区別がわかりにくい。
sen.e: Therefore, when used on paper, the shin (the core) (the stroke made with the brush) and the nijimi (the portion of calligraphic work that seeps outward through the paper, blurring the edges of the brush stroke) are difficult to distinguish.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, when used on paper, the shin (the core) (the stroke made with the brush) and the nijimi (the portion of calligraphic work that seeps outward through the paper, blurring the edges of the brush stroke) are difficult to distinguish.

Therefore, when used on paper, the shin (the core) (the stroke made with the brush) and the nijimi (the portion of calligraphic work that seeps outward through the paper, blurring the edges of the brush stroke) are difficult to distinguish.

sen.j: 年月が経って乾燥した墨は、膠の分解もすすむためにのびが良い。
sen.e: When the sumi gets old and dry, the animal glue decomposes, and therefore the ink becomes more stretchable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When sumi gets old and dry, the animal glue decomposes, and therefore the ink flows better.
When sumi gets old and dry, the animal glue decomposes, and therefore the ink flows better.

sen.j: 墨色に立体感が出て、筆の運びにしたがって芯や滲みなど墨色の変化が美しく出るとされる。
sen.e: The ink color gains three-dimensionality, and it is said that the variation in the ink color according to the brush movement, such as the shin and nijimi, gains aesthetic expression.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ink color gains three-dimensionality, and it is said that variation in the ink color according to the brush movement, such as the shin and nijimi, takes on aesthetic expression.
The ink color gains three-dimensionality, and it is said that variation in the ink color according to the brush movement, such as the shin and nijimi, takes on aesthetic expression.

sen.j: こうした墨は、「古墨」と呼んで珍重される。
sen.e: Such sumi is called 'koboku' (old inkstick) and they are highly prized.
Such sumi is called 'koboku' (old inkstick) and they are highly prized.
Such sumi is called 'koboku' (old inkstick) and they are highly prized.

sen.j: 墨が緻密に作られていれば、それだけ乾燥するまで長い年月がかかる。
sen.e: The more carefully the sumi is made, the longer it takes to dry.
The more carefully the sumi is made, the longer it takes to dry.
The more carefully the sumi is made, the longer it takes to dry.

sen.j: 固形墨は主な原料である煤の違いによって、松煙墨と油煙墨に分かれる。
sen.e: Depending on the soot, which is the main ingredient, solid sumi is divided into burnt pine ink and lamp soot ink.
Depending on the soot, which is the main ingredient, solid sumi is divided into burnt pine ink and lamp soot ink.
Depending on the soot, which is the main ingredient, solid sumi is divided into burnt pine ink and lamp soot ink.

sen.j: 朱墨、青墨、紫墨、茶墨などの表現がある。
sen.e: There are expressions such as red ink, seiboku (blue ink), purple ink and brown ink.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are expressions such as red ink, seiboku (blue ink), purple ink and brown ink.
There are expressions such as red ink, seiboku (blue ink), purple ink and brown ink.

sen.j: しかし、朱墨以外は基本的に黒色で、色調の傾向を示す言葉である。
sen.e: However, all except for the red ink are basically black in color, and these expressions are used to describe the shades of color.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, all, except for the red ink, are basically black in color, and these expressions are used to describe the shades of color.
However, all, except for the red ink, are basically black in color, and these expressions are used to describe the shades of color.

sen.j: 朱墨の原料は、鉱産物として天然に採掘される辰砂である。
sen.e: The ingredient of the red ink is cinnabar, which is a naturally occurring mineral that is mined.
The ingredient of the red ink is cinnabar, which is a naturally occurring mineral that is mined.
The ingredient of the red ink is cinnabar, which is a naturally occurring mineral that is mined.

sen.j: 松煙は燃焼温度にむらがあり、粒子の大きさが均一でない。
sen.e: Because of variations in the burning temperature, burnt pine soot has particle sizes that are uneven.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of variations in the burning temperature, burnt pine soot has particle sizes that are uneven.
Because of variations in the burning temperature, burnt pine soot has particle sizes that are uneven.

sen.j: したがって、重厚な黒味から青灰色に至るまで墨色に幅がある。
sen.e: Therefore, there is a wide range of ink color from dense black to bluish grey.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, there is a wide range of ink color from dense black to bluish grey.
Therefore, there is a wide range of ink color from dense black to bluish grey.

sen.j: 青みがかった色のものは青墨（せいぼく）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Those that have a bluish hue is called seiboku (blue ink).
Those that have a bluish hue are called seiboku (blue ink).
Those that have a bluish hue are called seiboku (blue ink).

sen.j: 製法は、マツの木片を燃焼させて煤を採取する。
sen.e: As for the manufacturing method, pinewood pieces are burnt and the soot is obtained.
As for the manufacturing method, pinewood pieces are burnt and the soot is obtained.
As for the manufacturing method, pinewood pieces are burnt and the soot is obtained.

sen.j: 青墨には、煤自体が青く発色するもの以外に、アイ (植物)などで着色するものもある。
sen.e: For the blue ink, besides the soot itself having a bluish color, some may be colored with indigo (plant).
For the blue ink, besides the soot itself having a bluish color, some may be further colored with indigo (plant).
For the blue ink, besides the soot itself having a bluish color, some may be further colored with indigo (plant).

sen.j: ランプブラックは、煤の粒子が細かく均一で、黒色に光沢と深味がある。
sen.e: Lampblack has soot particles that are fine and even in size, and therefore it has luster and depth to its black color.
Lampblack has soot particles that are fine and even in size, and therefore it has luster and depth to its black color.
Lampblack has soot particles that are fine and even in size, and therefore it has luster and depth to its black color.

sen.j: 製法は土器に、油を入れ灯芯をともし、土器の蓋についた煤を集めて作る。
sen.e: As for the manufacturing method, it is made by putting oil and lighting a wick in a clay pot, and by collecting the soot that forms on the lid of the clay pot.
As for the manufacturing method, it is made by putting oil and lighting a wick in a clay pot, and by collecting the soot that forms on the lid of the clay pot.
As for the manufacturing method, it is made by putting oil and lighting a wick in a clay pot, and by collecting the soot that forms on the lid of the clay pot.

sen.j: 油は、アブラナが最適とされるが、他にゴマ油や大豆油、ツバキ、キリなどがある。
sen.e: For the oil, Chinese cozla is considered to be the most suitable, but others, such as sesame oil, soy bean oil, camellia and paulownia are also used.
For the oil, Chinese cozla is considered to be the most suitable, but others, such as sesame oil, soy bean oil, camellia and paulownia are also used.
For the oil, Chinese cozla is considered to be the most suitable, but others, such as sesame oil, soy bean oil, camellia and paulownia are also used.

sen.j: 膠
sen.e: Animal Glue
Animal Glue
Animal glue

sen.j: 墨の製造で使われるゼラチンには、動物の骨や皮、腱などから抽出したコラーゲン（動物性タンパク質）が用いられる。
sen.e: Collagen (animal protein) extracted from animal bones, skin and tendons is used for the gelatin used in the production of sumi,
Collagen (animal protein) extracted from animal bones, skin and tendons is used for gelatin in the production of sumi,
Collagen (animal protein) extracted from animal bones, skin and tendons is used for gelatin in the production of sumi.

sen.j: 高級なものでは鹿、通常は牛や豚、羊、ウサギなど、安価なものでは魚などが使われる。
sen.e: High-quality binders use deer, but cows, pigs and rabbits are normally used, and fish is used for the inexpensive one.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: High-quality binders use deer, but cows, pigs and rabbits are normally used, and fish is used for the inexpensive product.
High-quality binders use deer, but cows, pigs and rabbits are normally used, and fish is used for the inexpensive product.

sen.j: 魚の膠を使ったものは独特な臭いが出る。
sen.e: Those that use animal glue made from fish have a distinctive smell.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sumi made with animal glue made from fish has a distinctive smell.
Sumi made with animal glue made from fish has a distinctive smell.

sen.j: それを補うものとして、化学的に合成された合成樹脂（接着剤と同様な成分）が用いられることもある。
sen.e: Chemically synthesized resin (whose ingredients are similar to those of adhesives) may be used in order to make up for it.
Chemically synthesized resin (whose ingredients are similar to those of adhesives) may be used in order to make up for it.
Chemically synthesized resin (whose ingredients are similar to those of adhesives) may be used in order to make up for it.

sen.j: 固形墨においても墨液においても、年月が経てば膠の成分が変質して弱くなる。
sen.e: Whether it's solid sumi or liquid sumi, the components of animal glue deteriorate over time.
Whether it's solid sumi or liquid sumi, the components of animal glue deteriorate over time.
Whether it's solid sumi or liquid sumi, the components of animal glue deteriorate over time.

sen.j: これを「膠が枯れる」という。
sen.e: This is called 'withering of the animal glue.'
This is called 'withering of the animal glue.'
This is called 'withering of the animal glue.'

sen.j: 作った当初は膠が強くて粘りがある。
sen.e: When sumi is first made the animal glue is strong and elastic.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When sumi is first made the animal glue is strong and elastic.
When sumi is first made the animal glue is strong and elastic.

sen.j: 紙に書いた場合、芯（筆で書かれた部分）と滲みの差が小さい。
sen.e: When applied on paper, the difference between the shin (the part that's written with the brush) and nijimi is small.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When applied on paper, the difference between the shin (the part that's written with the brush) and nijimi is small.
When applied on paper, the difference between the shin (the part that's written with the brush) and nijimi is small.

sen.j: しかし、年月を経ると膠が枯れ、滲みも増えて墨色の表現の自由度が広がる。
sen.e: However, the animal glue withers with time, and the extent of nijimi increases, expanding the freedom of expression with the tones of sumi color.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the animal glue withers with time, and the extent of nijimi increases, expanding the freedom of expression with the tones of sumi color.
However, the animal glue withers with time, and the extent of nijimi increases, expanding the freedom of expression with the tones of sumi color.

sen.j: 水分が多いと書いた線の部分から滲みが大きく広がる。
sen.e: If there is a lot of water, then nijimi expands greatly from the line that is drawn.
If there is a lot of water, then nijimi expands greatly from the line that is drawn.
If there is a lot of water, then nijimi expands greatly from the line that is drawn.

sen.j: この状態を「墨が散る」という。
sen.e: This condition is called 'scattering of sumi.'
This condition is called the 'scattering of sumi.'
This condition is called the 'scattering of sumi.'

sen.j: 長い年月を経て膠の枯れた固形墨を「古墨」という。
sen.e: Solid sumi whose animal glue has withered with time is called 'koboku.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Solid sumi where the animal glue has withered with time is called 'koboku.'
Solid sumi where the animal glue has withered with time is called 'koboku.'

sen.j: 伸びやかな線質や立体感、無限な色の表現が可能になる。
sen.e: It becomes possible to create lively lines and three-dimensionality as well as to express with unlimited colors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It becomes possible to create lively lines and give a sense of three-dimensional appearance as well as to express with unlimited colors.
It becomes possible to create lively lines and give a sense of three-dimensional appearance as well as to express with unlimited colors.

sen.j: そのため、特に淡墨の作品では不可欠であり、高値で取引される。
sen.e: Therefore, it is indispensable, especially in works of light ink painting, and it is expensive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処，淡墨 定訳不明
sen.e: Therefore, it is indispensable, especially in works of light ink painting, and it is expensive.
Therefore, it is indispensable, especially in works of light ink painting, and it is expensive.

sen.j: 膠は動物性蛋白質であるため低温下では粘性が増しゲル化・ゼリー状になり、書作に適さなくなる。
sen.e: Because the animal glue is animal protein, it becomes more viscous and turns into a gel at low temperatures, which is not appropriate for calligraphic work.
Because the animal glue is animal protein, it becomes more viscous and turns into a gel at low temperatures, which is not appropriate for calligraphic work.
Because the animal glue is animal protein, it becomes more viscous and turns into a gel at low temperatures, which is not appropriate for calligraphic work.

sen.j: そのため墨は一定以上の気温下で使用しなければならない。
sen.e: Therefore, sumi needs to be used at temperatures above a certain level.
Therefore, sumi needs to be used at temperatures above a certain level.
Therefore, sumi needs to be used at temperatures above a certain level.

sen.j: 墨を練る技術以外に、墨の形が重要となる。
sen.e: Besides the technique to knead sumi, the shape of sumi is also important.
Besides the technique to knead sumi, the shape of sumi is also important.
Besides the technique to knead sumi, the shape of sumi is also important.

sen.j: 墨型彫刻師が木型を製作し、多様な形態がある。
sen.e: Sumi mold engraver creates a wooden mold, and there are many different shapes.
A sumi mold engraver creates a wooden mold, and there are many different shapes.
A sumi mold engraver creates a wooden mold, and there are many different shapes.

sen.j: 明治20年代、小学校教員をしていた田口精爾が冬場に冷たい水で墨をする生徒達を見て液体の墨を作る事を発起。
sen.e: During the 1880's, Seiji TAGUCHI, who was an elementary school teacher, came up with the idea of making liquid sumi when he saw his students grinding sumi with cold water during winter.
During the 1880's, Seiji TAGUCHI, an elementary school teacher, came up with the idea of making liquid sumi when he saw his students grinding sumi with cold water during winter.
During the 1880's, Seiji TAGUCHI, an elementary school teacher, came up with the idea of making liquid sumi when he saw his students grinding sumi with cold water during winter.

sen.j: 東京職工学校（現・東京工業大学）で応用化学を学び、その後、墨汁を発明。
sen.e: He studied applied chemistry at Tokyo Vocational School (present-day Tokyo Institute of Technology), and he later invented bokuju.
He studied applied chemistry at Tokyo Vocational School (present-day Tokyo Institute of Technology), and he later invented bokuju.
He studied applied chemistry at Tokyo Vocational School (present-day Tokyo Institute of Technology), and he later invented bokuju.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）に「開明墨汁」と名付け商品化し、田口商会（現在の開明株式会社）を牛込区築土八幡（現在の新宿区）に創業した。
sen.e: In 1898, he named it 'Kaimei Bokuju' (Kaimei liquid sumi ink) and commercialized it, and he founded Taguchi Company (present-day KAIMEI & Co., Ltd.) in Tsukudo Hachiman, Ushigome Ward (present-day Shinjuku Ward).

In 1898, he named it 'Kaimei Bokuju' (Kaimei liquid sumi ink) and commercialized it, and he founded Taguchi Company (present-day KAIMEI & Co., Ltd.) in Tsukudo Hachiman, Ushigome Ward (present-day Shinjuku Ward).

In 1898, he named it 'Kaimei Bokuju' (Kaimei liquid sumi ink) and commercialized it, and he founded Taguchi Company (present-day KAIMEI & Co., Ltd.) in Tsukudo Hachiman, Ushigome Ward (present-day Shinjuku Ward).

sen.j: 墨汁には天然由来の煤ではなく工業的に作られたカーボンブラック（炭素）を使っているものがある（このカーボンは、複写機などで使われるトナーとほとんど同じ成分である場合もある）。
sen.e: There are some bokuju that use industrially produced carbon black (carbon) (in some cases, this carbon has almost the same constituents as toners used in copy machines) instead of naturally derived soot.

There are some bokuju that use industrially produced carbon black (carbon) (in some cases, this carbon has almost the same constituents as toners used in copy machines) when compared to naturally derived soot.

There are some bokuju that use industrially produced carbon black (carbon) (in some cases, this carbon has almost the same constituents as toners used in copy machines) when compared to naturally derived soot.

sen.j: また膠の代わりに接着剤のような化学的に合成された樹脂を使っているものがある。
sen.e: In addition, there are those that use chemically synthesized, adhesive-like resin instead of animal glue.
In addition, there are those that use chemically synthesized, adhesive-like resin instead of animal glue.
In addition, there are those that use chemically synthesized, adhesive-like resin instead of animal glue.

sen.j: 膠を用いた墨液の場合、裏打ちをするときには長時間乾かす必要がある。
sen.e: In the case of bokuju made with an animal glue, a long drying time is necessary when adding a lining.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the case of bokuju made with an animal glue, a long drying time is necessary when adding a lining.
In the case of bokuju made with an animal glue, a long drying time is necessary when adding a lining.

sen.j: 乾かす時間が短いと墨が散ってしまう。
sen.e: If the drying time is short, then the sumi will scatter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If the drying time is short, then the sumi will scatter.
If the drying time is short, then the sumi will scatter.

sen.j: 濃かったり膠の枯れた墨液では、墨の散りが激しい。
sen.e: In liquid sumi that's either thick or whose animal glue has withered, there is an extensive scattering of the sumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In liquid sumi that's either thick or the animal glue has withered, there is an extensive scattering of sumi.
In liquid sumi that's either thick or the animal glue has withered, there is an extensive scattering of sumi.

sen.j: したがって、そういった散りを防ぐスプレーなども市販されている。
sen.e: Therefore, sprays that prevent such scattering are commercially available.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, sprays that prevent such scattering are commercially available.
Therefore, sprays that prevent such scattering are commercially available.

sen.j: 自分で裏打ちする際には注意が必要である。
sen.e: It is necessary to be careful when applying a lining by oneself.
It is necessary to be careful when applying a lining by oneself.
It is necessary to be careful when applying a lining by oneself.

sen.j: 墨に含まれる膠は、動物性のタンパク質である。
sen.e: The animal glue contained in sumi is animal protein.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The animal glue contained in sumi is animal protein.
The animal glue contained in sumi is animal protein.

sen.j: 細菌にとって絶好の繁殖地であるため腐敗が早い。
sen.e: It deteriorates quickly because it is a perfect breeding ground for bacteria.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It deteriorates quickly because it is a perfect breeding ground for bacteria.
It deteriorates quickly because it is a perfect breeding ground for bacteria.

sen.j: それを防ぐために市販の墨液には防腐剤が含まれている。
sen.e: In order to prevent that, commercially available bokuju contains preservatives.
In order to prevent that, commercially available bokuju contains preservatives.
In order to prevent that, commercially available bokuju contains preservatives.

sen.j: 固形墨には防腐剤の成分が含まれない。
sen.e: Solid sumi does not contain preservatives.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Solid sumi does not contain preservatives.
Solid sumi does not contain preservatives.

sen.j: そのため、磨った墨液は保存がきかないので直ぐに使い切る必要がある。
sen.e: Therefore, liquid sumi made by grinding does not last long, and it is necessary to use it up right away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, liquid sumi made by grinding does not last long, and it is necessary to use it up right away.
Therefore, liquid sumi made by grinding does not last long, and it is necessary to use it up right away.

sen.j: 液体墨の防腐剤は時間がたてば弱くなり、およそ2年程で腐ると言われている。
sen.e: The preservatives in liquid sumi deteriorate over time, and it is said that it decays in about two years.
The preservatives in liquid sumi deteriorate over time, and it is said that it decays in about two years.
The preservatives in liquid sumi deteriorate over time, and it is said that it decays in about two years.

sen.j: 腐った墨は動物特有の腐敗臭を放ち、筆を傷めるので使うのは避ける。
sen.e: Rotten sumi emits a characteristic order of decaying animal, and since it damages the brush, the use of rotten sumi should be avoided.
Rotten sumi emits a characteristic order of decaying animal, and since it damages the brush, the use of rotten sumi should be avoided.
Rotten sumi emits a characteristic order of decaying animal, and since it damages the brush, the use of rotten sumi should be avoided.

sen.j: 防腐剤の強いものは筆を傷める可能性がある。
sen.e: Those with strong preservatives can possibly damage the brush.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sumi with strong preservatives can possibly damage the brush.
Sumi with strong preservatives can possibly damage the brush.

sen.j: そのため、高価な筆を使う場合は粗悪な墨液を使うことは避けるべきである。
sen.e: Therefore, when using an expensive brush, one should avoid using low-quality liquid sumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, when using an expensive brush, one should avoid using low-quality liquid sumi.
Therefore, when using an expensive brush, one should avoid using low-quality liquid sumi.

sen.j: また、一度容器から出した墨液は戻さないように注意が書いてあることがある。
sen.e: In addition, there is a cautionary note stating that liquid sumi that has once been poured out of the container should not be returned back into the container.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, there is a cautionary note stating that liquid sumi that has once been poured out of the container should not be returned to the container.
In addition, there is a cautionary note stating that liquid sumi that has once been poured out of the container should not be returned to the container.

sen.j: これは容器内の墨液が腐るのを防ぐためである。
sen.e: This is for preventing the liquid sumi in the container from spoiling.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is to prevent the liquid sumi in the container from spoiling.
This is to prevent the liquid sumi in the container from spoiling.

sen.j: 日本の会社が作っている墨液には粗悪な成分を含むことはほとんどない。
sen.e: Liquid sumi made by Japanese companies hardly ever contains low-quality ingredients.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Liquid sumi made by Japanese companies hardly ever contains low-quality ingredients.
Liquid sumi made by Japanese companies hardly ever contains low-quality ingredients.

sen.j: しかし、安価な輸入品には注意が必要である。
sen.e: However, attention should be paid to cheap imports.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, attention should be paid to cheap imports.
However, attention should be paid to cheap imports.

sen.j: 逆に高品質な墨液は、固形墨を磨ったものにも見劣りしない。
sen.e: On the other hand, high-quality liquid sumi stands up to those made by grinding solid sumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, high-quality liquid sumi stands up to those made by grinding solid sumi.
On the other hand, high-quality liquid sumi stands up to those made by grinding solid sumi.

sen.j: したがって、一流の書家にも愛用者が増えている。
sen.e: Therefore, there is a growing number of users among top-class calligraphers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, there is a growing number of users among top-class calligraphers.
Therefore, there is a growing number of users among top-class calligraphers.

sen.j: 硯で墨を磨っただけでは、好みの墨にならない。
sen.e: A desired sumi ink cannot be obtained solely by grinding sumi against suzuri (ink stone).
A desired sumi ink cannot be obtained solely by grinding sumi against a suzuri (ink stone).
A desired sumi ink cannot be obtained solely by grinding sumi against a suzuri (ink stone).

sen.j: 一例として指の腹などで墨を磨り直し、粒子を細かくするなどして、好みの墨色に合わせるなど、いろいろな方法が取られている。
sen.e: Various methods are used such as, for example, grinding sumi with the ball of a finger to create fine particles so as to adjust the desired ink color.
Various methods are used such as, grinding sumi with the tip of a finger to create fine particles o adjust the desired ink color.
Various methods are used such as, grinding sumi with the tip of a finger to create fine particles to adjust the desired ink color.

sen.j: また水の量や硬水・軟水など水の硬度、紙との相性、書く日の気温や湿度によっても墨色や墨の広がりなどが変わってくる。
sen.e: Furthermore, the amount of water and the quality of the water, such as whether the water is hard or soft, compatibility with the paper, temperature and humidity of the day when the sumi is used all affect the color of the sumi as well as how the sumi expands.

Furthermore, the amount of water and the quality of the water, such as whether the water is hard or soft, compatibility with the paper, temperature and humidity of the day when the sumi is used all affect the color of the sumi as well as how the sumi expands.

Furthermore, the amount of water and the quality of the water, such as whether the water is hard or soft, compatibility with the paper, temperature and humidity of the day when the sumi is used all affect the color of the sumi as well as how the sumi expands.

sen.j: 特に淡墨では差が出やすい。
sen.e: The effect tends to appear more readily specially in light ink painting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The effect tends to appear more readily specially in light ink painting.
The effect tends to appear more readily specially in light ink painting.

sen.j: 書家は好みの墨（磨墨液）を作るために各々研究している。
sen.e: Each calligrapher studies how to make his or her sumi (surusumijiru) to her taste.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Each calligrapher studies how to make his or her sumi (surusumijiru) according to their own taste.
Each calligrapher studies how to make his or her sumi (surusumijiru) according to their own taste.

sen.j: 墨磨機と呼ばれる墨を磨る機械が市販されている。
sen.e: Machines that grind sumi called sumi grinding machine are sold commercially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Machines that grind sumi called sumi grinding machines are sold commercially.
Machines that grind sumi called sumi grinding machines are sold commercially.

sen.j: 大量に墨を使用する人には重宝している。
sen.e: They are appreciated by people who use large amounts of sumi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are appreciated by people who use large amounts of sumi.
They are appreciated by people who use large amounts of sumi.

sen.j: 墨がついた筆を洗う際に口で吸う人もいるが、健康被害などに気をつける必要がある。
sen.e: Some people use the mouth to suck on the brush with sumi on it when cleaning, but it is necessary to be aware of the health hazards.
Some people use the mouth to suck on the brush with sumi on it when cleaning, but it is necessary to be aware of the health hazards in doing this.
Some people use the mouth to suck on the brush with sumi on it when cleaning, but it is necessary to be aware of the health hazards in doing this.

sen.j: 豚や牛などから作られた膠は宗教上大きな問題がある。
sen.e: Animal glue made from pigs and cows can be a serious religious issue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Animal glue made from pigs and cows can be a serious religious issue.
Animal glue made from pigs and cows can be a serious religious issue.

sen.j: したがって、口に含むような指導は外国人に対しては特に気をつけるべきである。
sen.e: Therefore, one should especially be careful when instructing foreigners to put the brush in the mouth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, one should especially be careful when instructing foreigners to put the brush in the mouth.
Therefore, one should especially be careful when instructing foreigners to put the brush in the mouth.
